CRISPR.definition: A gene-editing tool that lets scientists change DNA with precision.
CRISPR.why: It could cure diseases, modify crops, or even alter future generations.
CRISPR.misha: Scissors for the code of life - powerful, precise, profound.

Digital twin.definition: A virtual copy of a real object, process, or system - used for simulation, monitoring, or optimization.
Digital twin.why: It helps companies predict, plan, and test without touching the real thing.
Digital twin.misha: A ghost of the real - alive with data, watching the original.
